intro: Dryandra lindleyana, commonly known as the Narrow-leaf Dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and striking, pinkish-white inflorescences. The plant is typically found in sandy soils and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat. It produces small, clustered flowers that attract nectar-feeding birds and insects. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a valued species in horticulture and conservation efforts.
